title: Police: Male, 17, Hurt In St. Paul Shooting
content:
ST. PAUL, Minn. (WCCO) – Authorities are investigating after a 17-year-old male was hurt in a shooting in St. Paul on Monday.
The St. Paul Police Department was called to a report of a shooting at about 1:45 p.m. on the 400 block of Maryland Avenue West. When officers arrived, they found a victim suffering from at least one gunshot wound.
The victim was taken to Regions Hospital with serious injuries. Police say no arrests have been made, and what led up to the shooting is under investigation.
